reviewText: This is one of my very favorite Firm videos -- the one I always turn to after I've gotten out of the exercise habit, and the one that always makes me want to work out again!This video alternates low-impact aerobics with weight work, as in most Firm videos. If I haven't worked out in a long time, I usually feel energized and pleasantly sore afterward -- the way you do when you know you've used your muscles but not overdone it. The video uses fairly standard exercises for the muscles: biceps curls, pushups, squats, dipts, etc. The low-impact moves are fun and creative, and the music is great! Not too cheesy, like in some videos. If you run or do a lot of aerobics work, this probably won't get your heart rate very much -- aerobic work isn't The Firm's strength.Tracey Long is a fabulous instructor. She's not overly chatty or fake, and she uses excellent form and gives frequent reminders so that you do, too. She also has a great body -- muscular but not bulky.You will need a tall box (about 12 inches), three sets of dumbbells (if you've been very sedentary, try 2, 3 and 5 pounds for women) and a 4-foot dowel. The Firm sells all this stuff, but you can buy it pretty cheaply at (...)or similar stores. Tip: Buy the 12-inch Rubbermaid toolbox -- you can use it to work out, plus keep your videos and stuff in!
summary: A great intro to The Firm
Title: N/A

reviewText: Yep, this workout is 14 years old, but it is still great, especially if you haven't worked out for awhile(and are getting back into it), or if you want a lighter, yet excellent workout.  Tracie Long is one of the best instructors out there, and her cuing is excellent.  I have had this tape for many years, and love it!!
summary: One of the Best of the Best!
Title: N/A

reviewText: I purchased this tape and the other two Firm Basics tapes.  They are as good as everyone says they are for getting you back into shape.  I've been alternating the three tapes for a little over a month and have lost 2 sizes  and though I don't quite look like a skinny person in the mirror yet, I  sure feel like one.  My body shape seems to improve on a daily basis.  If  you've been thinking about getting workout tapes but are afraid to because  you're so out of shape ... I suggest starting with the Firm Basics Trio.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Tracie Long is the greatest instructor of all the Firm videos I have (5).  She explains how to do the moves, and also shows how not to do them.  She is big on getting you into the right form for things and stretching, which  is very important. This tape is really geared towards beginners and you  really will notice your progress after doing it a few times.  For someone  starting out, I cannot recommend this tape enough.  But if you are more  advanced, you probably won't find this much of a workout or would want to  use it on "light" days.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I am 39 and have been doing the Firm since I was 18.The Firm Basic Series is a good idea for shorter workouts. I do this workout when I am on vacations! It is a good muscle shaping work out!
Title: N/A

reviewText: it was my first firm workout, and has been my springboard and the one i come back to since i bought it in 1997. Tracie Long is such an excellent enthusiastic instructor, and she was so gracious to me as i was babbling that to her on the FitPrime website that i still cant help talking her up.  good luck to her and the Fitprime series as i read on this site sounds like another wonderful workout that i do intend to add to my collection at some point. the other Firm videos, The Tortoise and the Hare and All weights workouts are excellent.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Tracie Long is a great instructor, always demonstrating proper form, and is easy to follow.  I use the "Firm Basics" series along with Leslie Sansone to get started exercising again after being inactive for a while.  This tape is for beginners, and those who find the new "Firm" workouts beyond their capabilties.  A great start to better fitnes.This series is not produced on DVD.  It would be great if it was.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I recently purchased this on DVD and it has been a life saver! After months of down time and away from fitness, I lost a lot of strength and stamina. I love many of the Firm workouts including The Classics, however most are too challenging at this point for me to do and still feel successful. This workout is a notch or 2 less intense, less reps, fewer strength exercises, and does not include the famous Tall Box Climbs, although the Fanny Lifter is used for strength work. I would rate this DVD for the High Beginner/Low Intermediate and a nice "light" strength workout for anyone more advanced.Tracie Long is an excellent lead and her cueing is perfect. She is encouraging without being perky. She is calm and ever the professional who is an inspiration just looking at her. You're in good hands anytime you workout with Tracie. For those that are new to strength or have been away from it for long periods of time, this will help to get you back on track. Some form pointers are given in the workout as usual and the pace is slower than tradidtional Firm and Firm Classics workouts. If you purchase the DVD, you have a seperate segment that gives you a form tutorial. The Workout itself is 46 mins long and you will need 3 pairs of weights- light, medium, and heavy. You will also need a dowel or broom stick, fanny lifter or other 14 inch step for strength work, and a mat for floor work. If you have bladder troubles the pelvic floor is targeted throughout the DVD for those that may find this as an added benefit. You have intervals of strength and low impact aerobics and the choreography isn't overly complex. If you can do hamstring curls and grapevines, you can do this.I would rate myself at a low intermediate level and I found this workout to be just about perfect. Anything more intense at this point and it's a struggle or it's too uncomfortable to keep up. Anything less than this I'd feel like I was standing still. I have to say that I really love how the dowel was used for lunges and I will incorporate that into other Firm DVDs. It helps you so much with your form and unexpectedly, really helps to take the momentum out of the movements so the muscles work harder with less weights. This will be in my regular rotation until I can safely do workouts like Boomers and Tortoise and Hare again. I'd buy this one again in a heartbeat as I find it would be great for pregnancy, post-pregnancy, and of course anytime coming off an injury or illness. It's also something to keep just for lighter, less complicated days when you don't want to put in the mental or physical effort. The Firm Classics are the best and this is no different!
Title: N/A
